arm_group.description: cholecalciferol 20 µg per day for 12 weeks

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to investigate whether a supplementation of 20 µg Vitamin D3 per
      day for 12 weeks can be used to normalize vitamin d-Status

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Effects of a Recommendation Based Supply of Vitamin D3 in Healthy Volunteers

detailed_description.textblock:
It is the objective of this study to investigate whether a supplementation with Vitamin D3
      can be used to normalize insufficient vitamin d status and reduce atherosclerotic risk
      factors such as hypertension, inflammation and hyperlipidemia. The research question is
      whether Vitamin D3 reduces the level of systemic inflammation and whether Vitamin D3 has an
      effect on blood lipids.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy volunteers

          -  age between 18 and 70 years

          -  informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  use of antihypertensive medication

          -  use of vitamin d or calcium supplements

          -  known renal, inflammatory or malignant diseases

          -  hypercalcemia or hypercalciuria

          -  participation in other clinical studies

          -  use of tanning booths during the study

          -  pregnancy or lactating period

intervention.description: daily dosage of 20 µg Vitamin D3 for 12 weeks

clinical_study.official_title: Study on the Effects of a Recommendation Based Supply of Vitamin D3 in Healthy Volunteers - a Randomized Trail

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

primary_outcome.description: major outcome variable is the increase of 25-hydroxyvitamin D3 in the treatment group in comparison with the placebo group

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: It is the objective of this study to investigate whether a supplementation with Vitamin D3 can be used to reduce atherosclerotic risk factors such as hypertension, inflammation and hyperlipidemia. The research question is whether Vitamin D3 can reduces the level of systemic inflammation and whether Vitamin D3 has an effect on blood lipids.
It is the objective of this study to investigate whether a supplementation with Vitamin D3 can be used to reduce inflammation as an atherosclerotic risk factor
It is the objective of this study to investigate whether a supplementation with Vitamin D3 can be used to reduce hyperlipidemia as an atherosclerotic risk factor

collaborator.agency: German Federal Ministry of Education and Research

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
